intro: Atriplex patula var. hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf saltbush, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its gray-green, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, typically in the spring, and is adapted to thrive in saline and alkaline soils. It is often found in desert scrublands, along streambanks, and in disturbed sites. Atriplex patula var. hastata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
